clawback.translation[0].definitions[0].d: when a company takes back new shares that it had offered to its present shareholders, but they do not want to buy, and offers them to other investors
clawback.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Just over 5.2 million new shares are being placed, with 3.1 million subject to clawback.
clawback.translation[0].definitions[1].d: when an authority gets back money from a person who previously received it from them
clawback.translation[0].definitions[1].e: In the privatisation of Belfast airport, the Audit Office criticized the Treasury for not including a clawback clause on any future resale.
